newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile Nov industrial output up 1.6 pct on 1995.
newsitem.headline: Chile Nov industrial output up 1.6 pct on 1995.

text.p: Chilean industrial production grew 1.6 percent in November against the same month in 1995, with sales rising 2.2 percent, said trade group Sociedad de Fomento Fabril (Sofofa).
Sofofa's figures showed industrial output rising 2.2 percent in the first 11 months of last year, with sales up 2.6 percent.
Industrial production slowed in November against October with output down 4.6 percent and sales off 1.9 percent.
"We can conclude that the industrial sector ended the year with a poor performance as the result of the adjustment," said Sofofa referring to the Central Bank's restrictive monetary policy.

Areas with the greatest increase in output in the first 11 months of the year included glass manufacturing, up 23 percent, iron and steel output, up 16 percent and the production of non-metallic minerals which rose 12 percent.
Falls were seen in chemical production and the output of oil derivatives which both fell nine percent in the first 11 months against the same period 1995.
